name: Beautyblender pro
about: What it is:.What it does:.What it is formulated WITHOUT:.What else you need to know:
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Wet Beautyblender with water for each use..-Squeeze out excess liquid, using a towel if necessary..-Bounce powder or liquid foundation, BB cream, or cover-up for a flawless finish. .-Use the rounded end for large surface application and the contoured tip for more precision...How to care:.-Cleanse* after each use to help maintain the integrity of the blender's exclusive material. .-Replace every three months for the best bounce. ..*For best results, Beautyblender recommends using their blendercleanser (sold separately) to cleanse.

Turns outu2026this is quite awful and I should be more trusting ud83dude02. While the black color transferring from the sponge to my face wasnu2019t an issue for me, this sponge weirdly absorbs makeup like a vacuum.   To explain: I typically run my blenders under lukewarm water and squeeze it so itu2019s damp but not holding liquid. Then I LIGHTLY bounce the sponge to blend my makeup (this is essentially no added pressure but just allowing it to bounce on my skin). And every single time the makeup ends up removed from my face entirely. I use Patrick Tau2019s cream foundation if that matters (I donu2019t think it should ud83eudd37ud83cudffbu200du2640ufe0f).   I most certainly would NOT recommend purchasing this but rather opting for a less porous (?) sponge - something like the Ibra Marble Beauty Blender or the Make Up For Ever HD Skin Sponge. These do not absorb makeup and work very well to spread product and blend evenly.

reviews.review_title: Performs horribly. Not worth the price!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Disclaimer: So I didnu2019t purchase the Beauty Blender probthrough Sephora but wanted to see if other review had issues I did. (Purchased through Ulta) anyhow I usually prefer a brush but on occasion I like to switch it up depending on my coverage level. However I am no newbie when it comes to make up sponges. Iu2019ve tried real techniques, Fenty Beauty and E.L.F to say the least and all Iu2019ve had enjoyed using. Lately I have wanted to try out the BB since I never had and wanted to see if there was any difference and if it was worth the 20$ price tag attached to it. Given all the hype I drove my butt over to Ulta and purchased one. My choices were the OG pink blender, some pink orange swirled blender and the the beauty blender pro black. I had seen a influencer on YT rave about the black one over the pink so I decided black it is. Upon taking it out of the package I noticed it felt soft and squishy but a little more pourous compared to other blenders Iu2019ve tried. Honestly I thought Fenty felt squisher than this one but went ahead and ran it under the faucet, rung it out and put it in a towel to soak up any excess water so it would perform its best. Let me tell you this thing sucked up all the foundation I put on my face and did not distribute evenly. I applied another layer just for it to look good in some places and so patchy in others. Never in my life had I had such a issue blending out my foundation. I had to use 3x the amount as normal just to achieve my desired coverage which is insane because I usually use 2 pumps all together one for each side of my face. Sometimes not even that many. I tried it 3 more times after thinking it might have a learning curve but no! This thing just sucks. Iu2019m glad to see other reviews talking about the cheap feeling and how it performed bad. For 20$ bucks I at least expect this thing to do its job. I like the ELF total face sponge waaaaayyy more than this and itu2019s 4$ at Walmart. Needless to say save your coins!!!!
I wouldnu2019t buy this again. It does the trick but I find it to be very rough and textured compared to other beauty blenders I have purchased. Might just be the issue with this shade of sponge.

reviews.review_text: I've used a BeautyBlender Pro for years. This is a useful blender, but I'm unimpressed. Its price and short life span (3 months) make the BeautyBlender Pro exorbitant and unnecessary. I have tried a number of sponges for applying foundation, blending contour, and setting powder, including ELF, Sephora, BeautyBlender, Tarte, and others. Sephora's makeup sponges are far better options, as they absorb water more readily, are softer, and possess an elasticity that makes application smoother. AND the Sephora sponges I purchased (Penguin duo at Christmastime) were a QUARTER of the price. Why splurge on something if it doesn't deliver splurge-worthy results?

reviews.review_text: I NEVER write reviews, but I had to show up for those of us who go out of our way and out of our budget to continue to repurchase the the black beauty blender because it WAS legit better than any other beauty sponge. I had tried a bunch of drugstore/affordable beauty sponges that just couldn't compare. But when I stocked up on this recently, I noticed it wasn't the same sponge anymore. It didn't feel the same way - it was too dense and hard, absorbed way too much product, the material was not as soft and flexible - it felt like every other sponge I had tried and not loved - which at $20 per sponge, I am NOT down for.  When I got home, I even wet my old sponge I was replacing and compared them side by side and realized they were not the same sponge even though they were both black beauty blenders. What's going on!? I will repeat these steps a second time usually with much less foundation than the first time and  just in areas that need more coverage..  Then the foundation will give me a full coverage look and is completely blended into my skin giving me flawless looking skin. Your skin will not look cakey! reviews.review_text: If you havenu2019t tried any of these products yet, youu2019re seriously missing out.  This is the ONLY foundation u201cbrush/spongeu201d Iu2019ll ever use.  Brushes just suck; they always leave my face streaky, make you lose product, and never good at getting medium/full coverage.  This beauty blender is phenomenal, thereu2019s nothing like it, not even the knock off brands come close to this beauty blender.  It works best when wet and itu2019s a little more firm than the original B.B.  which I say is better for full makeup looks.  Itu2019s easy to clean out and lasts a LONG time (so long as you clean it regularly!).  Itu2019s so easy to use and easy to hold.  Your makeup will look flawless with this and will minimal makeup loss.  I suggest using the stippling method with this as well.  The texture is great and isnu2019t as porous as you may think.  Itu2019s still a sponge, but the foundation doesnu2019t sink to the center like you may think.  Iu2019ve cut up my old one which Iu2019ve had for a year, and the center was completely untouched by foundation (even without regular cleaning).  Offbrand BB soak up way more foundation, and donu2019t blend as nicely, and arenu2019t as clean.  Definitely save up for this brand, because once you try it, youu2019ll understand why this is a MUST-HAVE for everyone who uses foundation.  The tip is super easy to use to get around your nose too and corners of your eye! Give this a try and youu2019ll never want to go back to your hands/brush.  If for some reason this doesnu2019t work for you, Sephora has a great return policy.  I strongly believe everyone should at least give a B.B. one try to really understand how good it is.

The only issue, which doesnu2019t really bother me personally, is that it u201cstainsu201d fast (bc itu2019s black) but that can easily be solved by washing it. Iu2019ve removed a star due to this inconvenience and the fact that Iu2019ve spent about $350 on them over the last four  years... but a remaining four stars because nothing works quite the same.

It's still a perfect sponge but knew I needed to get a new one because I could tell mold was growing inside from being used almost everyday (that happens after a while because you can't get them to dry immediately after use) so I ordered it again. The quality is nearly that of a disposable sponge which is unacceptable for the price. It wastes foundation & when you're blending over it picks up & leaves it to make foundation look uneven. Not to mention it leave black sponge specks behind :( I'm sad about this because I was really looking forward to the same quality of the old version. Also it was misshaped on the bottom & not perfectly round.. Needless to say I'm not giving up on the brand because I had rely heavily on this sponge so I'm returning immediately after I get the original one in the mail.

reviews.review_title: Somehow even better than other colors??
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm already a forever fan of beauty blenders, so I'll spare you my experience of how much it changed my makeup game. This review is for the black 'pro' BB, as I have found it to be somehow even better than the original pink and the nude which I've also tried. As a full disclaimer, I might be feeling this way because its a fresh blender after using my previous pink one till it had chunks in it (I clean it religiously each time before using, don't think I'm gross). However, the black version is so soft and fluffy and while I'll see if it stays this way over time, I'll be buying only this color from here on out. Another advantage to this pro color is that it doesn't look dirty and stained (which the other colors do look like over time despite daily washing).   TL;DR Buy a beauty blender if you haven't already, and if you're wondering which color to get, try the black 'pro'! (You won't go wrong with any color, though).

reviews.review_text: I've tried countless makeup sponges, and the BeautyBlender still can't be beat. I especially like the black one, for some reason it blends makeup a bit better than the original pink.  Other sponges are too latex like, when you squeeze them when wet, they take a while to return to their normal shape.  Not the Beauty Blender.  It's springy, and foamy, and bouncy and soft and makes quick blending effortless.  Just try it, with gentle use and cleaning it will last for months and months. Oh, and don't just dampen it, soak it while squeezing under running water, then squeeze a few times in a towel.
